content:
Quantitation of CAT Enzyme Activity in Injected Sea Urchin Embryos
Collect embryos into an Eppendorf tube at the desired developmental stage,
using a drawn-out Pasteur pipette. Also collect tubes of about the same
number of uninjected embryos to be used both as uninjected controls and to
be added to bacterial CAT enzyme standards (usually about five different
amounts of CAT enzyme are included per experiment to obtain a standard
curve).
Spin in microfuge 5 min at room temperature.
Aspirate off the sea water. At this point. the embryo  pellets may be
stored at for later use.
Remove the tubes from and put on ice. Resuspend the injected-embryo
pellets and control pellets in 100 ul of 250 mM Tris (ph 7.8). Resuspend
the embryos that are to be added to the bacterial standards in 50 ul of
250 mM Tris. Vortex each tube. Freeze-thaw (dry ice-ethanol then 
each embryo suspension 3X to lyse the cells.
Briefly spin the contents to the bottoms of the tubes.
Add the 100 ul of injected and uninjected control embryo lysates to glass
tubes (10 75 mm) containing:
so ul 250 mM Tris (pu 7.8)
29 ul H20
1 ul 14C-chloramphenicol
Add 50 ul of uninjected embryo lysates to each of five glass tubes
containing:
known amount (from 0.5 - 8 10'3 U) of bacterial
CAT enzyme in 250 mM Tris (pH 7.8)
29 ul H20
1 ul 14C-chloramphenicol
250 mM Tris (pH 7.8) to bring final vol acetyl to each tube. Cover with parafilm. Incubate
for 2 at 
Add 1 ml of ethyl acetate (use glass pipette) to each tube. Vortex well.
Briefly spin to separate the phases. Transfer the top organic phase (Be
careful not to remove any of the bottom aqueous phase.) to clean glass
tubes.
Cover with parafilm. Poke holes in the paraffin with a needle and dry the
samples in a Savant speed-vac concentrator (takes ~20 min).
Take up the dried samples (one at a time) in 20 ul of ethyl acetate and
dot onto a TLC plate about 1" from the bottom.
Chromatograph for about 1-1.5 hr in containing chlorqgormzmethanol
ees
